poem:
### The School WhatsApp Group

Inside the digital village square,  
our fingers tip-tap the surface of chaos.  
Here, no wind whispers, no birds sing—  
just the ping of instant consternation.  
Yet, amid the cluttered threads  
of complaint and overzealous smiles,  
one can still find  
a single line of laughter  
holding everything in place.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "No moaning about the teachers and definitely no nudes! How to survive the school WhatsApp group Becoming a parent can be one of the richest, most rewarding things you can ever experience. That said, it’s a qualified reward, because to be a parent is often to be forced into joining the school WhatsApp group. In theory, it’s a community of like-minded peers who understand that it takes a village to raise a child. In reality, the school WhatsApp". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
